title: Afshan Khan
subtitle:
Pleased to participate in the #RefugeeForum this week. 

The Global Compact on Refugees provides concrete commitments to protect the rights of refugee children & host communities. 

Now is the time to turn commitments into action. #AChildIsAChildpic.twitter.com/Ier34eadL9

title: Ivo Freijsen
subtitle: The most inspiring stories I have heard at the #RefugeeForum have been from Afghans Onaba, Hina & Forouzan. Their message: give refugees the chance to thrive not just survive & they will build a better future for themselves, their home country and their communities. pic.twitter.com/h9ajOHzdXJ

title: CaldewSchool
subtitle:
Drum roll please.........We have collected 1100 pairs of socks this week that will be distributed to refugees over the festive period. Thank you to parents and students who have supported our appeal. 
Wishing you a very happy and peaceful Christmas. pic.twitter.com/AfNvVqoNgH

title: Naveed
subtitle: For example Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan which had over 120,000 Syrian refugees is full of Saudi donated homes for these people, medical centres and clothes donated by the Saudi government and its people. I’ve worked alongside Saudi medics and they’re extremely humble people. pic.twitter.com/NjrCcCYAbK

and met with Rwandese, Congolese, Somali & South Sudanese refugee youth in Uganda who are demanding #SilecningTheGuns and learnt from the them the challenges of refugees and their needs for protection, education and livelihoods.

title: Meritxell Relano
subtitle:
An important discussion at the #RefugeeForum this morning on how investments in water & sanitation must serve the immediate needs of refugees & the long-term needs of communities and countries.
@UNICEFWaterpic.twitter.com/1Y0OOBsXHu

title: Gillian Triggs
subtitle:
Protecting refugees requires the world to work together.

To support fair and efficient national asylum systems we’ve launched the Asylum Capacity Support Group at the #RefugeeForum today. This will play a key role in strengthening protection for refugees
http://www.unhcr.org/5defe77b7.pdf#zoom=95 …pic.twitter.com/wxvG9yuf3Y

subtitle: Global Refugee Forum Spotlight Session @ UN Geneva pic.twitter.com/T99djIMzHo – at Conference Room XVII

title: Muzoon  Al-Mellehan
subtitle:
In 2018, I urged governments to prioritize children’s education in the Global Compact on Refugees.

Today, I urge governments to make sure every child - including refugee children and host communities - can access their right to quality education. #AChildIsAChild #RefugeeForumpic.twitter.com/uBwLD4nBCH

title: George Okoth-Obbo
subtitle: I delightfully exposed my lack of form + skills to be part of a wonderful evening of footballing at International School Geneva in which refugee players and local Swiss clubs mixed to showcase the power of sport in the protection, healing and inclusion of refugees. #RefugeeForumpic.twitter.com/shyx1hg5VS

title: Tatiana Valovaya, Director-General of UN Geneva
subtitle: An honor to host in the #PalaisDesNations the 1st ever #RefugeeForum with @antonioguterres, @FilippoGrandi & @ignaziocassis. Today was a key step to build on the Global Compact on Refugees, our new blueprint to address refugee crises in a collective & inclusive way. pic.twitter.com/UKp9pJo6pd

title: Charlotte Slente
subtitle:
The Global #RefugeeForum is an opportunity to go from words to action for refugees and host communities worldwide.

Along with this team, I am here working for responsibility sharing, long-term solutions, protection and other means to a dignified life for all displaced. pic.twitter.com/UZZxzA2yDc
